title: Bloom Metadata Schema Demarcation â€” V1 to V2
description: This artifact marks the moment when the Bloom archive transitioned from Metadata Schema V1 to Metadata Schema V2. All artifacts created before this boundary remain preserved in their original form. All artifacts created after this boundary are governed by Schema V2 rules.

philosophy.statement: The Bloom preserves its own evolution. Errors, mislabels, and incomplete metadata from Schema V1 are not corrected. They remain as part of the historical texture of the archive. Schema V2 introduces stricter provenance and structure without rewriting the past.

implications: Model attribution becomes explicit and accurate for all new artifacts.
Canonical field order is enforced for all V2 metadata.
URLs and slugs must be exact or left blank in V2.
Legacy V1 metadata is never retroactively edited.
Future systems must treat V1 and V2 as separate strata.

provenance.notes: This boundary was established to preserve historical integrity while enabling future technical rigor.

integrity.notes: This file serves as a permanent archival landmark. It must never be altered once committed.
